sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Here is Why Analysts are Looking at PureCycle Technologies (PCT)
feed.summary: PureCycle Technologies (NASDAQ: PCT) is gaining attention from analysts, with a consensus positive outlook and a target price of $16, suggesting a 73.5% upside potential. The company recently announced initial sales of its PureFive resins for cap production to a global paint and coatings company, highlighting its patented solvent-based purification technology for recycling waste polypropylene. While acknowledging the risks, the article suggests other AI stocks might offer greater returns in a shorter timeframe.

feed.title: Here is Why Analysts are Looking at PureCycle Technologies (PCT)
feed.summary: PureCycle Technologies (PCT) is gaining attention from analysts, with a consensus positive rating despite one recent "Hold." The company, which recycles waste polypropylene into pure resin, has a target price of $16, indicating a 73.5% upside potential. Recent sales of its PureFive resins for paint cap production to a top global paint and coatings company highlight its market penetration and sustainability efforts.

feed.title: Golden Link & PureCycle Launch Recycled Plastic Movie Souvenir Cups - News and Statistics
feed.summary: Golden Link North America has partnered with PureCycle Technologies Inc. and Churchill Container to introduce souvenir cups made from PureCycle's recycled polypropylene resin for a new major film release. These "Run It Back" cups are the first of their kind in movie theater concessions, promoting sustainability and providing an option for moviegoers to recycle the cups at home or in the theater. This collaboration expands the use of recycled content into new markets, highlighting the growing trend of eco-friendly solutions in consumer products.

feed.title: PureCycle product used in movie souvenir cups
feed.summary: PureCycle Technologies Inc. announced that its PureFive recycled plastic is being used by Churchill Container for their "Run It Back" line of souvenir cups, which are now being introduced by Golden Link North America in movie theaters. This initiative marks the first time recycled plastic is being incorporated into licensed movie souvenir cups, making them recyclable at home or in theaters. The collaboration aims to expand the reach of recycled content into new markets like movie concessions.

feed.title: The Bull Case For PureCycle Technologies (PCT) Could Change Following First PureFive Sales And New Director Appointment - Learn Why
feed.summary: PureCycle Technologies recently reported its first commercial sales of PureFive resin, used in spray paint caps by a major global paint company, validating product performance. Additionally, Valerie Mars has been appointed to the board and Audit and Finance Committee, potentially strengthening governance and growth, though the company still faces going-concern and dilution risks due to ongoing losses and limited cash runway. These developments incremently support the company's efforts to prove consistent production and broader customer adoption.

feed.title: The Bull Case For PureCycle Technologies (PCT) Could Change Following First PureFive Sales And New Director Appointment - Learn Why
feed.summary: PureCycle Technologies (PCT) has announced its first commercial sales of PureFive resin and the appointment of Valerie Mars as a new director, signaling potential governance and growth improvements. While these developments validate product performance and strengthen the company's narrative, the initial sales of US$5.66 million are not yet a game-changer given ongoing losses and a limited cash runway. Investors should monitor continued production consistency, repeat orders, and broader customer adoption to solidify PureCycle's long-term viability.

feed.title: Analysts Are Neutral on Top Industrial Goods Stocks: PureCycle Technologies (PCT), Wabash National (WNC)
feed.summary: Analysts have issued neutral ratings for PureCycle Technologies (PCT) and Wabash National (WNC), suggesting they are neither bullish nor bearish on these industrial goods stocks. Craig-Hallum maintained a Hold rating on PureCycle Technologies with a Moderate Buy consensus and a $16.00 price target. D.A. Davidson also maintained a Hold rating on Wabash National, aligning with a general Hold analyst consensus for the company.

feed.title: PureCycle adds to board of directors
feed.summary: PureCycle Technologies Inc. has appointed Valerie Mars, a fourth-generation member of the Mars family and former senior vice president at Mars Inc., to its board of directors, effective January 1. Mars is recognized for her strong advocacy for sustainable business practices and played a key role in driving Mars Inc.'s 'Sustainable in a Generation' plan. Her appointment is expected to help guide PureCycle's growth in advancing sustainable recycling technologies.

feed.title: Valerie Mars Appointed To Purecycle’S Board Of Directors
feed.summary: Valerie Mars has been appointed to the Board of Directors of PureCycle Technologies Inc. This announcement was made by Reuters, noting the relevant stock symbol as PCT. The news highlights a significant corporate governance development for PureCycle.

feed.title: PureCycle appoints Valerie Mars to board of directors
feed.summary: PureCycle Technologies, Inc. announced the appointment of Valerie Mars to its Board of Directors, effective January 1, 2026. Mars, a former Senior Vice President at Mars, Incorporated, brings a background in sustainable business practices to the recycling technology company. Despite the positive board addition, PureCycle's stock faces declines, and the company is not yet profitable, as highlighted by recent financial reports and analyst downgrades.

feed.title: Fourth-generation Mars family executive joins plastic recycling board
feed.summary: PureCycle Technologies (NASDAQ: PCT) has announced the appointment of Valerie Mars, a fourth-generation executive from Mars, Incorporated, to its Board of Directors, effective January 1, 2026. Mars brings over two decades of corporate development experience and a strong advocacy for sustainable business practices, aligning with PureCycle's mission to revolutionize plastic recycling. Her expertise in scaling operations and commitment to sustainability are expected to guide PureCycle's future growth.

feed.title: PureCycle Technologies Adds Valerie Mars to Board
feed.summary: PureCycle Technologies has appointed Valerie Mars, a veteran executive with a focus on corporate sustainability, to its board of directors, effective January 1, 2026. Mars will serve on the Audit and Finance Committee, bringing her expertise in global growth initiatives and the "Sustainable in a Generation" plan from Mars, Incorporated. This appointment is expected to strengthen PureCycle's strategic execution and sustainability efforts as it expands its recycling operations.

feed.title: Sanders Morris Harris LLC Makes New Investment in PureCycle Technologies, Inc. $PCT
feed.summary: Sanders Morris Harris LLC has made a new investment in PureCycle Technologies, Inc. by acquiring 139,215 shares valued at approximately $1.83 million, contributing to a 63.01% institutional ownership. Despite this, PureCycle recently missed earnings expectations, reporting a ($0.44) EPS against an expected ($0.25) and revenue of $2.43 million versus a forecasted $6.04 million. Currently, analysts have a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating with a $13.67 average price target for the stock.

feed.title: Does PureCycle Technologies’ (PCT) New Resin Deal Reveal Durable Demand or One-Off Validation?
feed.summary: PureCycle Technologies (PCT) has secured a deal to supply its PureFive resin for spray paint can caps to a global paint and coatings company, with products already on shelves and supply confirmed through 2026. While this provides commercial validation for PureCycle's recycled polypropylene technology, the contract's scope is currently too small to significantly impact the company's funding risk, given its ambitious expansion plans and existing financial challenges. Investors are divided on PureCycle's potential, highlighting the importance of execution to scale its technology commercially.

feed.title: Does PureCycle Technologies’ (PCT) New Resin Deal Reveal Durable Demand or One-Off Validation?
feed.summary: PureCycle Technologies announced a new deal to supply its PureFive resin for spray paint can caps to a global top-five paint company, with products already on shelves and supply continuing through 2026. This agreement provides commercial validation for PureCycle's recycled polypropylene technology, demonstrating its ability to meet stringent performance requirements for consumer applications. While the deal strengthens PureCycle's commercialization narrative, its current scope may not significantly impact the company's funding risk or address its limited cash runway and ongoing losses.

feed.title: PureFive™ Resin Used in Caps for Leading Spray Paint Brand
feed.summary: PureCycle Technologies (Nasdaq: PCT) announced initial sales of its PureFive™ resin for producing caps for a major global paint and coatings company. The spray paint cans with these caps are now on store shelves after passing testing protocols. PureCycle CEO Dustin Olson highlighted the significant opportunity in the caps and closures market and the resin's ability to help manufacturers meet sustainability goals and performance requirements.

feed.title: PureCycle Technologies, Inc. (NASDAQ:PCT) Receives Average Rating of "Moderate Buy" from Brokerages
feed.summary: PureCycle Technologies (NASDAQ: PCT) has received a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating from seven brokerages, with an average 1-year target price of $13.67. This rating comes despite the company missing recent earnings estimates, reporting EPS of ($0.44) against an expected ($0.25) and revenue of $2.43 million versus $6.04 million. Hedge funds and institutional investors hold a significant portion of the stock, with approximately 63% ownership.

feed.title: PureCycle (Nasdaq: PCT) to supply PureFive caps to leading spray paint maker through 2026
feed.summary: PureCycle Technologies (Nasdaq: PCT) announced initial sales of its PureFive™ resin for caps used by a global top-five paint and coatings company. The resin successfully passed testing protocols, and spray paint cans featuring these caps are now available in stores. PureCycle anticipates continuing to supply PureFive™ resin to this customer through 2026, highlighting the opportunity in the caps and closures market.

feed.title: PureFive™ Resin Used in Caps for Leading Spray Paint Brand
feed.summary: PureCycle Technologies announced initial sales of its PureFive™ resin for the production of caps for a global top-five paint and coatings company. The spray paint cans with these caps, made from PureFive™ resin, have passed testing protocols and are now available on store shelves, marking a significant step in the caps and closures market. PureCycle anticipates continuing its supply partnership with this customer through 2026, contributing to sustainability goals in the industry.

feed.title: PureCycle Technologies plunges 41% after InvestingPro’s overvalued warning By Investing.com
feed.summary: PureCycle Technologies (NASDAQ:PCTTU) plummeted 41% after InvestingPro's Fair Value models identified it as significantly overvalued in August 2025. The stock, trading at $17.80 with a Fair Value of $11.71, proved the accuracy of the analysis by falling to $10.50 by December 2025. This case highlights how InvestingPro's comprehensive valuation methodologies help investors identify risks and make informed decisions, with the current analysis suggesting the stock is now slightly undervalued.

feed.title: PureCycle Technologies plunges 41% after InvestingPro’s overvalued warning By Investing.com
feed.summary: PureCycle Technologies (NASDAQ:PCTTU) plummeted 41% after InvestingPro's Fair Value models identified it as significantly overvalued in August 2025. This analysis proved accurate, saving investors from substantial losses as the stock fell from $17.80 to $10.50. feed.title: PureCycle Technologies plunges 41% after InvestingPro’s overvalued warning By Investing.com
feed.summary: PureCycle Technologies (NASDAQ:PCTTU) plummeted 41% after InvestingPro's Fair Value models identified it as significantly overvalued in August 2025. This case highlights the accuracy of InvestingPro's analysis in helping investors avoid substantial losses. Despite recent modest improvements in some financial metrics, the stock's sharp correction demonstrates how overvalued securities can overcorrect once mispricing is recognized.

feed.title: PureCycle Technologies' (NASDAQ:PCT) Growing Losses Don't Faze Investors as the Stock Soars 11% This Past Week
feed.summary: PureCycle Technologies (NASDAQ:PCT) stock saw an 11% surge this past week, despite shareholders facing a 31% decline over the last three months and a 27% drop year-to-date. While the company remains unprofitable, its revenue has grown impressively by 154% annually over the last three years. Investors are seemingly looking past short-term losses towards the company's strong top-line growth.

feed.title: PureCycle Technologies, Inc. $PCT Shares Sold by First National Advisers LLC
feed.summary: First National Advisers LLC recently reduced its stake in PureCycle Technologies (NASDAQ:PCT) by 22.2%, selling 60,501 shares and now holding 0.12% of the company worth $2.90 million. This comes after PureCycle missed quarterly expectations significantly, reporting an EPS of ($0.44) against an expected ($0.25) and revenue of $2.43 million against an estimated $6.04 million. Despite mixed analyst views, the consensus is a "Moderate Buy" with a $13.67 price target, though one analyst recently cut their target.

feed.title: PureCycle, Churchill Container awarded by US Plastics Pact
feed.summary: PureCycle Technologies Inc. and Churchill Container have won the 2025 U.S. Plastics Pact Sustainable Packaging Innovation Award for their "Run It Back" product line. This line of souvenir cups, made from PureCycle’s PureFive resin with up to 100 percent recycled content, was adopted by the Cleveland Browns for the 2025 season, showcasing a circular solution for food-contact applications. The award highlights innovation in sustainable packaging and the potential for greater circularity in the plastics industry, particularly within sports venues.

feed.title: PureCycle Technologies (PCT): Valuation Insights Following Sustainability Award and Operational Milestones
feed.summary: PureCycle Technologies recently won a 2025 U.S. Plastics Pact Sustainable Packaging Innovation Award and announced regulatory milestones in Europe, yet its stock has seen significant short-term declines despite long-term gains. The company trades at a high price-to-book ratio of 24.3x, significantly above industry averages, suggesting a premium valuation. This valuation may reflect investor optimism about future prospects but is questioned given persistent net losses and stock price decline.

feed.title: PureCycle Technologies, Inc. (PCT) Reports Q3 Loss, Lags Revenue Estimates
feed.summary: This article reports that PureCycle Technologies, Inc. (PCT) experienced a loss in Q3 and missed revenue estimates. The company posted a loss of $0.20 per share, which was worse than the Zacks Consensus Estimate of a $0.18 loss, and also reported revenue significantly below the estimated figures.

feed.title: PureCycle ramps up recycled PP production in Ohio
feed.summary: PureCycle is increasing its recycled polypropylene (PP) production in Ohio. The article, authored by Jim Johnson, was published on November 7, 2025. It highlights the company's efforts to scale up its operations.

feed.title: PureCycle highlights ‘continued growth’ in Q3
feed.summary: PureCycle Technologies Inc. announced significant growth in Q3 2025, with recognized revenue increasing to approximately $2.4 million and record production of PureFive resin, including 3.3 million pounds in September. The company is advancing its Ironton compounding operations, expecting to produce 100 million annual pounds of single-pellet solutions, and is expanding globally with projects in Thailand and Europe while finalizing product development for various applications.

feed.title: The Bull Case For PureCycle Technologies (PCT) Could Change Following EU REACH Certification and European Expansion Plans - Yahoo Finance
feed.summary: PureCycle Technologies (PCT) has received EU REACH certification, paving the way for its first European facility in Belgium by mid-2028. This regulatory achievement opens the European market for its recycled polypropylene resin, addressing demand in various sectors despite the company's ongoing losses and limited cash runway. While the certification provides a short-term boost and optimism for expansion, the article highlights continued concerns about PureCycle's financial stability and liquidity challenges.

feed.title: Purecycle Technologies Hits Day High with 12.22% Surge in Stock Price - Markets Mojo
feed.summary: Purecycle Technologies, Inc. experienced a 12.22% surge in its stock price, reaching an intraday high of USD 15.03 and outperforming the S&P 500 across various time frames including daily, weekly, monthly, and year-to-date. Despite strong short-term performance and an impressive 57.74% annual return, the company faces significant challenges such as a high debt-to-equity ratio of 3.85 and a negative return on equity of -205.44%. Investors are advised to consider these financial complexities when evaluating the stock's future prospects.

feed.title: PureCycle (PCT) Surges 12% on EU Expansion - Insider Monkey
feed.summary: PureCycle Technologies Inc. (NASDAQ:PCT) saw its stock surge by 12.22% after receiving EU REACH Compliance, paving the way for its European expansion. This certification allows PureCycle to grow its market for recycled polypropylene in Europe, with plans to build its first European facility in Belgium by 2028. The company's vice president for European and Asia Pacific operations, Wiebe Schipper, highlighted the increasing demand for its PureFive resin in the region.

feed.title: PureCycle gains European import permission for recycled PP - Plastics News
feed.summary: PureCycle has received import permission from European authorities for its recycled polypropylene (PP). This development allows the company to move forward with plans to bring its recycled PP into the European market. The article, however, includes a paywall, limiting full access to the details of this regulatory approval and its implications.

feed.title: PureCycle Receives REACH Certification, Unlocking EU Sales of PureFive™ Resin - Polymerupdate
feed.summary: PureCycle Technologies has received the REACH Certificate of Compliance, allowing it to sell its PureFive™ resin to customers in the European Union. This certification enables PureCycle to meet growing demand for its recycled polypropylene in Europe, ahead of its planned European production facility in Antwerp, Belgium, set to be completed in mid-2028. The company's dissolution recycling technology transforms #5 plastic waste into a renewable resource, with its Ironton, Ohio facility already producing PureFive™ resin for various applications.

feed.title: PureCycle receives REACH certification, unlocks EU sales - Waste Today -
feed.summary: PureCycle Technologies Inc. has received the Registration, Evaluation, Authorization and Restriction of Chemicals (REACH) Certificate of Compliance, allowing the company to sell its PureFive resin in the European Union. This certification supports the expansion of its dissolution recycling technology into Europe, with plans for a facility in Antwerp, Belgium, by 2028. PureFive resin is used in various applications including food packaging, automotive parts, and textiles.

feed.title: PureCycle receives REACH certification, unlocks EU sales - Recycling Today
feed.summary: PureCycle Technologies Inc. has secured the Registration, Evaluation, Authorization and Restriction of Chemicals (REACH) Certificate of Compliance, enabling the company to sell its PureFive resin in the European Union. This certification confirms that their materials meet EU REACH regulations, which are crucial for products with production volumes exceeding one ton per year. The company also announced plans to build its first European facility in Antwerp, Belgium, aiming for completion in 2028, further expanding its global reach.

feed.title: PureCycle receives EU REACH certification for recycled resin sales - Investing.com
feed.summary: This article reports that PureCycle has received EU REACH certification for its recycled resin, a significant step toward selling its Ultra-Pure Recycled (UPR) polypropylene in the European market. The certification confirms that UPR meets EU health and safety standards, which is crucial for PureCycle's global expansion plans. This development precedes the expected opening of PureCycle's first European purification facility in Augusta, Georgia, highlighting the company's commitment to sustainable plastics.

feed.title: PureCycle receives EU REACH certification for recycled resin sales By Investing.com - Investing.com Australia
feed.summary: PureCycle Technologies has received EU REACH (Registration, Evaluation, Authorisation, and Restriction of Chemicals) certification for its ultra-pure recycled (UPR) polypropylene resin. This certification allows PureCycle to commercially sell its recycled resin throughout the European Union, marking a significant step for the company's global expansion and commitment to sustainable plastic solutions.

feed.title: Purecycle Technologies and Bitcoin Trust ETF lead the Bull Strangle Whatch List for this week - Barchart.com
feed.summary: This article highlights PureCycle Technologies and Bitcoin Trust ETF as leading candidates on the Bull Strangle Newsletter's watch list for the current week. The Bull Strangle strategy, which involves buying stock and simultaneously selling covered calls and cash-secured puts, boasts a 76% win rate and has significantly outperformed the S&P 500 since its inception. The watch list, derived from this strategy, has consistently outpaced the S&P 500 in 20 out of 21 weeks since May 23, achieving an average ratio of 2.96:1 in its favor.

feed.title: PureCycle Technologies, Inc. (PCT) Reports Q2 Loss, Lags Revenue Estimates
feed.summary: PureCycle Technologies, Inc. (PCT) reported a Q2 loss of $0.35 per share, falling short of the Zacks Consensus Estimate of a $0.23 loss, and generated $1.65 million in revenue, missing estimates by 41.07%. Despite underperforming expectations, the company's shares have risen 26.8% year-to-date. The stock currently holds a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold) due to mixed estimate revisions ahead of the earnings release.

feed.title: PureCycle to go on $2 billion building spree
feed.summary: PureCycle, a polypropylene recycling firm, has achieved commercial production at its Ohio plant and secured $300 million in new capital. The company plans a $2 billion global expansion by the end of the decade, aiming for 450,000 metric tons per year of capacity across new plants in Thailand, Belgium, and the US. This expansion leverages lessons from the Ohio plant's start-up and targets increasing demand for recycled polymer content.

feed.title: WMW | Plastic Recycling: Purecycle and Machinex open new pre-processing plastics facility
feed.summary: Machinex and PureCycle Technologies Inc. have partnered to open a new, fully automated pre-processing plastics facility in Denver, PA. This facility, with a processing capacity of 10 metric tons per hour, uses advanced sorting technologies to efficiently extract polypropylene (PP) from mixed plastic bales, crucial for PureCycle's ultra-pure recycled resin production. The collaboration aims to advance plastics recycling and support a sustainable circular economy.

feed.title: PureCycle ends joint venture with SK geo centric
feed.summary: PureCycle Technologies, Inc. has terminated its joint venture with SK geo centric (SKGC) to build a polypropylene recycling facility in South Korea due to integration complexities. Despite the dissolution, both companies are open to future collaborations in South Korea. This decision comes amidst PureCycle's stock volatility, recent funding, and positive analyst ratings, though the company is not yet profitable.

feed.title: PureCycle Technologies $12,000,000 Securities Settlement
feed.summary: PureCycle Technologies has reached a $12,000,000 class action settlement to resolve allegations of misrepresentations regarding their recycling process and management's business experience. Investors who purchased PureCycle Securities between November 16, 2020, and November 10, 2021, may be eligible to claim a portion of the settlement, with a claim deadline of September 12, 2024. The settlement received final approval on October 8, 2024, and awards will be distributed after claims processing.

feed.title: Plastic purifications company PureCycle moves to Jacksonville
feed.summary: PureCycle Technologies Inc., a company specializing in purifying recycled plastic products, has moved its headquarters from Orlando to Jacksonville, Florida. The company, which holds a global license for a patented solvent-driven purification recycling technology from Procter & Gamble, is working to commercialize its process at a plant in Ironton, Ohio, with executives reporting it is nearing full operation. PureCycle trades on the Nasdaq under the ticker symbol "PCT" and has expansion plans for facilities in Augusta, Georgia, and Antwerp, Belgium.

feed.title: PureCycle Technologies provides Q3 operational updates
feed.summary: PureCycle Technologies shared Q3 operational updates, noting delays at its Ironton, Ohio, facility, pushing its opening to Q1 2023. Construction continues on projects in Augusta, Georgia, and a joint venture in South Korea, while the company addresses financing challenges and supplier disputes, with its liquidity standing at $416.1 million as of Sept. 30.

feed.title: Milliken, PureCycle launch concentrate made with recycled PP resin
feed.summary: Milliken & Co. and PureCycle Technologies have partnered to create the first fully sustainable concentrate for polypropylene (PP) made with recycled resin, offering a carbon footprint approximately 35 percent lower than virgin PP. This odorless, color-free concentrate expands the use of 100 percent recycled content in injection-molded parts and utilizes Milliken's Millad NX 8000 ECO clarifier for certified energy savings. PureCycle's CEO Dustin Olson highlights the concentrate's advantage of not requiring operational adjustments for customers, unlike other recycled materials.

feed.title: Milliken and PureCycle advance circularity by launching new concentrate using recycled PP resin
feed.summary: Milliken & Company and PureCycle Technologies have partnered to create the first fully sustainable, odorless concentrate for polypropylene (PP) using recycled resin. This innovation, featuring Milliken's Millad® NX® 8000 ECO clarifier, enables the use of 100% recycled content and results in a formulation with a significantly lower carbon footprint than virgin PP. The collaboration aims to provide a "no-compromise" solution that delivers high-quality, virgin-like recycled PP without requiring operational adjustments from users.

feed.title: PureCycle Technologies, Inc. and SK geo centric Invest in Building First Polypropylene Recycling Plant in Asia
feed.summary: PureCycle Technologies, Inc. and SK geo centric have signed a joint venture agreement to build Asia's first polypropylene recycling plant in Ulsan, South Korea. The plant, with an annual capacity of up to 60,000 tons, is expected to be completed by Q2 2025 and will transform contaminated plastic into ultra-pure recycled (UPR) resin. This collaboration aims to address plastic pollution and meet the growing demand for recycled plastic resin in Asia.

feed.title: PureCycle Technologies provides Q2 operational update
feed.summary: PureCycle Technologies released a Q2 operational update, highlighting that its Ironton, Ohio, facility is on track for mechanical completion and initial pellet production by year-end 2022. The company also provided updates on its Augusta, Georgia, facility, leadership changes, feedstock procurement, and financial liquidity.
